title: CMI AV to Provide Production for World Meeting of Families
text: Email This Story Printer Friendly PDF Version RSS Feed CMI AV to Provide Production for World Meeting of Families CMI AV is a full-service audio/visual company with locations in both Albany and Rochester, New York. CMI is providing all production for the World Meeting of Families, taking place in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania this year. ALBANY, NY, September 24,   CMI Communications, a meeting and convention production company headquartered in Rochester, New York, is excited to announce that it has been contracted to manage the audio/visual production of the international World Meeting of Families Congress, which takes place this year in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, September 22nd through the 25th. The Congress rolls into the Papal events that will take place throughout Philadelphia, September 26th and 27th. "We are thrilled to take part in this significant event," says Eric Smith, President of CMI Communications. "We enjoy being able to provide this congress our full service production team and technical expertise. The scale and magnitude of this event, make this an exciting initiative for our team--we have been preparing for the event for the past nine months, and are eager and excited to see it through to fruition." CMI is providing all presentation staging and audiovisual equipment, including large scale LED screens, international media broadcast stations and interactive booths for the youth center. Two dedicated show managers from CMI along with a team of over 50 technical professionals will not only set up production at the Pennsylvania Convention Center, but will also be on site throughout the week to ensure the event runs seamlessly and as planned. The World Meeting of Families takes place once every three years, and 2015 will be the first time it is being held in the United States. This Vatican-sponsored event is expected to see an estimated 20,000 people over the course of the congress, and with over 7,000 international media representatives planning to attend, the convention will be well covered. CMI is also supporting the International Philadelphia Media Center for the week, displaying and managing the media needs for the world press. The convention will span three days, and will end with a much-anticipated appearance from Pope Francis. CMI AV, an audiovisual production company with offices in Albany and Rochester, NY, is a full service event and meeting production company that provides audiovisual and staging solutions to clients around the globe. With more than 25 years of industry experience and a team of dedicated professionals, CMI is one of the leading production and staging providers in the United States. For more information, please visit http://www.cmiav.com. # # #
